summary: Deer are hoofed animals belonging to the Cervidae family, divided into two main groups. Male deer, except for water deer, grow antlers each year, used for fighting. There are other similar animals in different families. Deer have been important in art, mythology, and culture for thousands of years. They provide food (venison), leather (buckskin), and antlers for tools. Deer hunting is a long-standing tradition and a source of income for many.
title: Deer
